00001 /* btb-2levbtac.cpp: Regular BTB, but with global/local branch history indexing */
00002 /*
00003  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00004  */

00006 #define COMPONENT_NAME "2levbtac"
00007 
00008 #ifdef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00009 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00010 {
00011   int l1size;
00012   int hist_width;
00013   int num_ents;
00014   int num_ways;
00015   int Xor;
00016   int tag_width;
00017   char replace_policy;
00018   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c",name,&l1size,&hist_width,&Xor,&num_ents,&num_ways,&tag_width,&replace_policy) != 8)
00019     fatal("bad BTB options string %s (should be \"2levbtac:name:l1size:hist_width:xor:entries:ways:tag_width:replacement_policy\")",opt_string);
00020   return new BTB_2levbtac_t(name,l1size,hist_width,Xor,num_ents,num_ways,tag_width,replace_policy);
00021 }
00022 #else

00024 class BTB_2levbtac_t:public BTB_t
00025 {
00026 
00027   /* struct definitions */
00028   struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t
00029   {
00030     md_addr_t PC;
00031     md_addr_t target;
00032     struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * prev;
00033     struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * next;
00034   };
00035 
00036   class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t:public BTB_sc_t
00037   {
00038     public:
00039     struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00040     struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t ** set;
00041     int * bhr;
00042     int lookup_bhr;
00043   };
00044 
00045   protected:
00046 
00047   int bht_size;
00048   int hist_width;
00049   int history_mask;
00050   int num_entries;
00051   int num_ways;
00052   int tag_width;
00053   char replacement_policy;
00054   struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t ** set;
00055   int *bht;
00056 
00057   int bht_mask;
00058   int btac_mask;
00059 
00060   int tag_shift;
00061   int tag_mask;
00062 
00063   int Xor;
00064   int xorshift;

00069   /* CREATE */
00070   BTB_2levbtac_t(char * const arg_name,
00071                  const int arg_bht_size,
00072                  const int arg_hist_width,
00073                  const int arg_Xor,
00074                  const int arg_num_entries,
00075                  const int arg_num_ways,
00076                  const int arg_tag_width,
00077                  const char arg_replacement_policy
00078                 )
00079   {
00080     init();
00081 
00082     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_bht_size);
00083     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_num_entries);
00084     CHECK_POS(arg_num_ways);
00085     CHECK_BOOL(arg_Xor);
00086     if(mytolower(arg_replacement_policy) != 'l' &&
00087        mytolower(arg_replacement_policy) != 'r')
00088       fatal("%s(%s) %s must be 'l' (LRU) or 'r' (random).",arg_name,COMPONENT_NAME,"replacement_policy");
00089 
00090     name = strdup(arg_name);
00091     if(!name)
00092       fatal("couldn't malloc 2levbtac name (strdup)");
00093 
00094     bht_size = arg_bht_size;
00095     hist_width = arg_hist_width;
00096     Xor = arg_Xor;
00097     num_entries = arg_num_entries;
00098     num_ways = arg_num_ways;
00099     replacement_policy = arg_replacement_policy;
00100     tag_width = arg_tag_width;
00101 
00102     bht_mask = arg_bht_size-1;
00103 
00104     history_mask = (1<<hist_width)-1;
00105 
00106     if(Xor)
00107     {
00108       xorshift = log_base2(num_entries)-hist_width;
00109       if(xorshift < 0)
00110         xorshift = 0;
00111     }
00112 
00113 
00114     btac_mask = num_entries-1;
00115 
00116     tag_shift = log_base2(num_entries);
00117     tag_mask = (1<<tag_width)-1;
00118 
00119     bht = (int*) calloc(bht_size,sizeof(int));
00120     if(!bht)
00121       fatal("couldn't malloc 2lev BHT");
00122 
00123     set = (struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t**) calloc(num_entries,sizeof(*set));
00124     if(!set)
00125       fatal("couldn't malloc 2levbtac set array");
00126     for(int i=0;i<num_entries;i++)
00127     {
00128       struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00129       for(int j=0;j<num_ways;j++)
00130       {
00131         p = (struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(**set));
00132         if(!p)
00133           fatal("couldn't malloc 2levbtac entry");
00134         if(set[i])
00135         {
00136           p->next = set[i];
00137           set[i]->prev = p;
00138           set[i] = p;
00139         }
00140         else
00141           set[i] = p;
00142       }
00143     }
00144 
00145     int bhtsize = bht_size*hist_width;
00146     int tagsize = 8*sizeof(md_addr_t) - log_base2(num_entries);
00147     int lrusize = log_base2(num_ways);
00148     int entrysize = sizeof(md_addr_t) + tagsize + lrusize + 1; /* +1 for valid bit */
00149     bits =  num_entries*num_ways*entrysize + bhtsize;
00150     type = strdup(COMPONENT_NAME);
00151   }
00152 
00153   /* DESTROY */
00154   ~BTB_2levbtac_t()
00155   {
00156     free(name); name = NULL;
00157     for(int i=0;i<num_entries;i++)
00158     {
00159       struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00160       struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * next = NULL;
00161       for(p=set[i];p;p = next)
00162       {
00163         next = p->next;
00164         free(p);
00165       }
00166     }
00167     free(bht); bht = NULL;
00168     free(type); type = NULL;
00169   }
00170 
00171   /* LOOKUP */
00172   BTB_LOOKUP_HEADER
00173   {
00174     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t*) scvp;
00175     int l1index;
00176     int l2index;
00177     struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00178     
00179     l1index = PC&bht_mask;
00180     sc->bhr = &bht[l1index];
00181     sc->set = NULL;
00182 
00183     if(Xor)
00184     {
00185       l2index = PC^(*sc->bhr<<xorshift);
00186     }
00187     else
00188     {
00189       l2index = (PC<<hist_width)|*sc->bhr;
00190     }
00191 
00192     l2index &= btac_mask;
00193     p = set[l2index];
00194 
00195     BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00196     sc->updated = false;
00197     sc->lookup_bhr = *sc->bhr;
00198 
00199     sc->set = &set[l2index];
00200     sc->p = NULL;
00201 
00202     while(p)
00203     {
00204       if(p->PC == ((PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask))
00205       {
00206         sc->p = p;
00207         return p->target;
00208       }
00209       p = p->next;
00210     }
00211 
00212     return 0;
00213   }
00214 
00215   /* UPDATE */
00216   BTB_UPDATE_HEADER
00217   {
00218     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t*) scvp;
00219 
00220     if(!sc->updated)
00221     {
00222       BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00223       BPRED_STAT(num_hits += oPC == our_target;)
00224       sc->updated = true;
00225     }
00226 
00227     if(!outcome) /* don't store not-taken targets */
00228     {
00229       BPRED_STAT(num_nt++;)
00230       return;
00231     }
00232 
00233 
00234     if(!our_pred)
00235     {
00236       int l2index;
00237       struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00238 
00239       if(Xor)
00240       {
00241         l2index = PC^(*sc->bhr<<xorshift);
00242       }
00243       else
00244       {
00245         l2index = (PC<<hist_width)|*sc->bhr;
00246       }
00247 
00248       l2index &= btac_mask;
00249       p = set[l2index];
00250 
00251       BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00252 
00253       sc->set = &set[l2index];
00254       sc->p = NULL;
00255 
00256       while(p)
00257       {
00258         if(p->PC == ((PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask))
00259         {
00260           sc->p = p;
00261           break;
00262         }
00263         p = p->next;
00264       }
00265     }
00266 
00267     if(sc->p)
00268     {
00269       /* had a BTB hit; update the target, put to front of list */
00270       sc->p->target = oPC;
00271       
00272       if(sc->p->prev == NULL) /* already at head */
00273         return;
00274       sc->p->prev->next = sc->p->next;
00275       if(sc->p->next)
00276         sc->p->next->prev = sc->p->prev;
00277 
00278       (*sc->set)->prev = sc->p;
00279       sc->p->prev = NULL;
00280       sc->p->next = (*sc->set);
00281       *sc->set = sc->p;
00282       return;
00283     }
00284     else
00285     {
00286       /* was a BTB miss; evict entry depending on replacement policy,
00287          update, and put to front of list */
00288       struct BTB_2levbtac_Entry_t * p;
00289       int pos=0;
00290       int randpos=0;
00291       p = *sc->set;
00292       if(replacement_policy == 'r')
00293         randpos = random()%num_ways;
00294 
00295       while(p)
00296       {
00297         if(replacement_policy == 'l' && !p->next)
00298           break;
00299         else if(replacement_policy == 'r' && pos==randpos)
00300           break;
00301         else
00302           pos++;
00303         p = p->next;
00304       }
00305 
00306       assert(p != NULL);
00307 
00308       p->target = oPC;
00309       p->PC = (PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask;
00310       
00311       if(p->prev == NULL) /* already at head */
00312         return;
00313 
00314       p->prev->next = p->next;
00315       if(p->next)
00316         p->next->prev = p->prev;
00317 
00318       (*sc->set)->prev = p;
00319       p->prev = NULL;
00320       p->next = *sc->set;
00321       *sc->set = p;
00322       return;
00323     }
00324   }
00325 
00326   BTB_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER
00327   {
00328     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t*) scvp;
00329     BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00330 
00331     *sc->bhr = ((*sc->bhr<<1)|our_pred)&history_mask;
00332     return;
00333   }
00334 
00335   BTB_RECOVER_HEADER
00336   {
00337     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t*) scvp;
00338     if(bht_size == 1)
00339         bht[0] = (sc->lookup_bhr<<1)|outcome;
00340   }
00341 
00342   BTB_FLUSH_HEADER
00343   {
00344     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t*) scvp;
00345     if(bht_size == 1)
00346       bht[0] = sc->lookup_bhr;
00347   }
00348 
00349   /* GET_CACHE */
00350   BTB_GET_CACHE_HEADER
00351   {
00352     class BTB_2levbtac_sc_t * sc = new BTB_2levbtac_sc_t();
00353     if(!sc)
00354       fatal("couldn't malloc 2levbtac state cache");
00355     return sc;
00356   }
00357 
00358 };
